column4: if i put something in the background with '&' and then pull it back with 'fg', is there any way to put it back in the background?..
yeah, then do bg I think
but when i fg it, i cant type commands.. cause the process 'takes over' the shell
i know.. do you mean i type bg in another shell?
well. when i fg the command i put in background, it doesnt let me type any command in that shell anymore. so i cant type bg.

you can use the 'jobs' command to see what's going on.  And if you start messing with multiple processes you can specify them with %[NUMBER]  which you get from the list.  So you can do 'fg %2' for example
oh great! none of those command have man pages.. precious info, thanks a lot :)
mind telling me also what the + and - next to the job numbers mean?..
yep, you can do kill %2 as well.  You can google 'bash job control'.  I don't know what the + and - are
I think man bash or man builtins probably talks about them
